div.sent: When two charged conductors are connected by a metal wire, what determines the flow of charge from one conductor to another?
It is not determined by the quantity of charge in them.
The factor on which flow of charge depends is known as electric potential or electric pressure.
It may be compared to temperature of water level.
The hot body will give heat and the cold one will take until their temperature becomes equal.
Again, two water containers A and B with water is connected by a tube.
There is a stop cork in the tube.
Container A is narrow and B is wide.
Water level in A is higher than that in B but B contains more water than A.
Open the stop cork and you will see water flows from A to B.
Water flow continues as water level in A is higher than in B.
The water flow stops as soon as water level in A and B are equal.
Pressure of water depends on water level.
So flow of water among the containers depends on the water level or the pressure of water, but not on their quantity of content.
Similarly, flow of charges between two charged Hight bodies connected electrically depends not on their charge contents but on the difference of electric potential.
As temperature indicates the thermal condition of a body, potential indicates the electrical condition of a conductor.
In a charged body, mutual repulsion among the charges produces a pressure.
This is known as electrical pressure.
In electricity electric potential is used instead of electric pressure.
Therefore, when two charged bodies are electrically connected, the electric condition, which determines the direction of charge flow, is called electric potential or electric pressure.
If two bodies of different potentials are connected by a wire, electricity flows through that wire.
Conventionally the direction of the current flow is taken from higher potential to lower potential.
But actually electron, the carrier of electricity, flows from lower potential to higher one.
The higher the potential difference between the bodies is, the higher the flow of current.
The less is potential difference, the less will be the current flow.
If there is no potential difference, there will be no flow of current.
So, in order to get continuous current flow adifference of potential must be maintained by any mechanism.
In electric cell the chemical energy and in dynamo mechanical energy is used to maintain potential difference.
This flow of negative charge in a definite direction is called electric current or simply current.
Mathematically, the quantity of charge that flows through any cross-section of the body per second is the current.
We know like charges repel each other and opposite charges attracts.
Based upon his discovery the unit of charge was determined.
In international unit the unit charge is named after his name and is called coulomb.
Thus 1 ampere flow of current means flow of 1 coulomb charge per second through any cross section;
10 ampere current means flow of 10 coulomb charge per second.
To measure small quantity of current two unit other units, milli-ampere and micro ampere are used.
International practical unit of potential is volt.
Water passes very easily through a wide pipe but can not flow that easily through a narrow tube.
Because, in wide pipe water faces less resistance than a narrow one.
So much water flows through wider tube.
So it is understood that wider were resist less the flow of electric current than the narrow wire.
The property for which resistance is offered to the flow of electric current is known as electrical resistance.
We know current is the flow of charges.
There are molecules, atoms in a conductor.
With them the moving electrons collide.
Such collision decreases electron movement for which current flow decreases too.
This obstruction to the flow of current is the resistance of the conductor.
Not all the matters have the same resistance.
Matters having less resistance conduct more current and those have greater resistance conduct less current.
The resistance of good conductors is less than that of bad conductors.
The resistance of wood, rubber, paper etc. are so high that almost no current passes through them.
They are called insulator or nonconductors.
Ohm is the S.I unit of resistance.
The resistance of a conductor depends on its length, cross-section, material, temperature and other physical conditions.
The unit of resistance defined above is a very small one.
So to measure high resistance its multiple, kilo ohm and mega ohm are used.
Power is the rate of doing work.
The work done in 1 second by electrical source or machine is called its power.
The practical unit of power is watt.
The rate of doing 1 joule work per second is called 1 watt.
Energy is the capacity for doing work.
Total work done is a measure of energy.
The practical unit of work or energy is joule.
The S.I unit of electrical energy is watt hour.
The commercial unit of electrical energy is kilowatt-hour.
The energy spent by a machine of 1 kilowatt when it works for 1 hour is called 1 kilowatt-hour.
One unit is usually taken as one kilowatt- hour.
To know how much electrical energy is consumed by a consumer in a house, school, shop, factory an electrical meter is installed.
We know from the meter reading how much energy has been consumed.
Direct Current: The current, which always flows in the same direction, is called direct current.
Electric cells or batteries give direct current.
The current does not change direction.
Batteries are used in torch light, radio, transistor, calculator, watch and electric toys.
This type of current is also produced by D.C generators.
This type of current was used before to light houses and run factories.
But it is not in use now a days for such purposes.
Alternating Current: The current, which changes direction after a certain time is called alternating current.
The electricity supplied in all the countries of world is alternating current.
This type of current is easy to supply and easy to use.
Dynamos or generator produce this current.
In this world electric supply companies supply this current by generator.
Alternating current is used to light bulbs, to run TV, fan, fridge, air conditioner and other electrical appliances.
The machinery of factories is run by this electricity.
In our house, Shops, offices A.C is used.
In our country alternating current changes direction 50 times per second.
Electric circuit: Series and Parallel circuits.
The complete path through which a current travels from positive end of the source to the negative end is called electric circuit.
In the electric circuit electric bulb, fan and other electrical appliances are connected.
The circuit can be opened or closed by using a switch.
Current flows when the circuit is closed and the flow stops when it is opened.
Certain symbols are used to draw an electric circuit.
Some of these symbols are shown in figure 13.3.
The tools and machinery in the circuit are connected in two ways.
In figure 13.4 two electrical bulbs are shown which connected in two different ways.
In fig two bulbs are connected one after another and then through a cell the circuit has been completed.
This type of connection is known as series connection and the circuit is known as series circuit.
This type of circuit is called parallel circuit.
In series connection same current flows through two bulbs.
The resistance offered by the two bulbs is greater than the resistance offered by a simple bulb.
So the brightness would be less when the two bulbs are connected in series than what would have been if one bulb was connected.
Again, if one of them is fused, the current through the whole circuit stops flowing and the other bulb will go off.
In series circuit when the the two bulbs light at a time and when the switch is off they go out together.
Bulbs can not be switched on or off separately.
Therefore, such type of connection is not suitable for houses and is not used either.
In parallel connection current flows through separate path for each bulb.
The potential difference will be the same for each bulb, so each bulb will get full driving strength of the cell.
As a result, each bulb will light brightly.
In parallel connection each bulb will light with the same brilliance as when the bulbs are connected one after another to a cell.
But the current that would flow through two bulbs would be twice the current that would flow through one.
As the same cell supplies current its life will be half.
If generator is used to supply current, the cost of electric energy for the two bulbs will be double than that for one bulb.
So, Parallel connection is better for house wiring.
The instrument used to measure current is known as ammeter.
Its full name is ampere meter.
This meter records current flow in ampere.
It is connected in series in a circuit.
Like a cell, ammeter also has two ends one is positive, and the other is negative.
The positive end is red in colour and the negative end is black.
The positive end of the ammeter is to be connected to the positive end of the cell.
Reverse connection would deflect the inbox in the backward direction instead of going forward.
The series connection of ammeter in a circuit must not change its current flow.
Therefore ammeter resistance is kept be low.
This is done by adding a small resistance in parallel with the coil, used to construct this meter.
This arrangement makes ammeter resistance minimum and so connection to circuit does not change its current significantly.
To know potential difference between any two points of a circuit we use another meter known as voltmeter.
This directly measures potential difference in volt.
It is connected in parallel to the points between which potential difference has to be measured.
Voltmeter also has a red positive end and a black negative end.
The red end is connected to the higher potential point and the black end is to the lower potential point.
In order of resist the flow of main current through voltmeter, high resistance is connected in series with it.
For this high resistance, very small current goes through voltmeter and thus does not alter the main flow significantly.
By a switch we start or stop current in an electrical circuit.
To on or off a torch light or an electric bulb in a house we make use of a switch.
A switch on means current is established and a switch off means current is cut off.
Thus, a switch is a device by which current is established or cut off through a circuit.
Every electric appliance like electric light, fan, T.V etc. has a separate switch to work.
Switch on the light bulb it is lighting, switch on the T.V. it starts working.
You need no light or fan, nor do you want to watch television any more, switch off their switches.
Thus by a switch you can start an electric machine or turn it off.
So, electricity is saved by a switch; don't keep a light or T.V on unnecessarily.
Stronger flow of current may cause fire in our houses.
To avoid such accidents, the fuse wire is used.
The fuse wire is a wire made of an alloy of metallic tin and lead.
It is narrow and has low melting point.
The wire is set on a china clay structure.
If the flow of current goes above the specific limit, this wire melts and as such the circuit is disconnected.
Thus by using fuses electric appliances are protected from being damaged due to an overflow of current.
A fuse is used in series in the circuit.
Fuses are of different values.
Generally, we use fuses of 5, 10, 15, 30, 60 ampere.
A 5 ampere fuse means a current flow of more than 5 ampere melts this fuse wire.
We use different ampere fuses for different appliances.
5 ampere fuse is used for lights, fans, T.V sets etc. 15 ampere fuses are used for electric irons and electric kettles.
We use 30 or 60 ampere fuses in the main switches.
If we use a fuse of 30 ampere with a television set, it will not serve the purpose.
Because a television set uses current up to 5 ampere; a flow of current reater than this will burn the television set.
So only a fuse of 5 ampere is suitable for a television set.
What happens if a fuse of 5 ampere is used with an electric kettle?
As soon as the switch is on, the fuse will melt and no current will pass to operate the kettle.
Electric kettles require current more then 5 ampere.
Use of the fuse of proper value makes protect electrical appliances from being burnt and damaged.
Again a fuse of smeller value than that is needed will make the appliance inactive.
We often use two or three small wires together to repair the fuse of our house wiring.
It should not be done as it may increase the strength of the fuse.
For example if we use two 5 ampere fuse wires together to repair a fuse it will have the value of a 10 ampere fuse.
The circuit breaker is a special kind of fuse which automatically breaks a circuit and makes it when necessary.
If for some reason the flow of current increases through a circuit, the circuit breaker goes off and stops the flow of current.
The flow automatically starts when the supply of current becomes normal.
Thus, circuit breaker protects electrical appliances.
The electric iron and electric kettle are covered with steel plates.
Inside the cover there is a coil of wire through which current flows and makes the steel-plates hot.
The wire of the coil is also covered by non conducting materials so that the currentcarrying wire can not touch the cover.
If for some error this wire touches the cover, the cover will be electrified.
In that case anybody touching the case will have a great shock.
For protection from such shocks such electrical appliances have three terminals for connection.
There are two terminals for positive and negative connection and the third one is for earth connection.
The earth terminal connects the cover to the earth i.e. ground.
So if the cover is electrified current flows to the ground directly.
This wire carries away additional current also.
Thus it acts as a fuse as well as a means of preventing electric shock to the users.
The earth pin of a three hole socket is connected to this line.
The human body is a conductor of electricity.
But the body has 50,000 ohm resistance at normal condition.
So a small current can not cause much harm to human body.
But a heavy current can cause much shock to our body and damage the body cells.
Current when passing through heart, may cause heart attack which even may lead to death.
The stronger the current is the greater is the possibility of death.
A wire is heated when current passes through it.
For some reason if a heavy current passes though, a wire may get very hot and cause fire.
Short circuit: Your path to school goes around a field but you often walk across the field to make the path shorter.
Same may be the case with current.
If for some reason current takes a shorter path instead of its usual longer path, short circuit takes place.
You may have seen two rubber or plastic coated long wires going to all important places of your house.
A wire carries current to an electric bulb and comes back after going through the bulb.
There is a very fine wire in the bulb which resists greatly to current and produces light.
But for some reason if the two wires are joined somehow, current gets a short circuit.
Again connections of many electrical appliances in the same circuit cause overload.
So avoid using the same socket to connect many appliances like light, fan, television set, fridge etc.
Use separate connection for each.
We use many electrical appliances in our daily life.
You have read about the design and function of the electric bulb, iron and heater in class seven.
Here, we shall discuss about another very simple instrument the electric bell.
The electric bell: In this instrument you will see practical use of magnet along with current.
Here a horse-shoe magnet is placed on an iron or wooden platform A hammer is fixed with a soft iron plate.
The soft iron plate is placed before the poles of the horse-shoe magnet and a spring is fixed with it on the above.
The closed end of the spring is connected to the coil wound on the electro magnet.
A screw remains in touch with the open end of the plate when there is no current.
This screw completes the electrical path through a switch, a battery and a coil of electro magnet.
A bell b is placed before the hammer.
Press the switch and the circuit is completed.
Current passes through the coil over the electro-magnet.
As a result, it becomes a strong magnet which attracts the soft iron plate A.
this attraction pushes the hammer to the bell and sounded it.
At the same time, as the hammer goes to strike the bell, the electric connection with screws goes off.
The flow of current stops;
as a result, the electro-magnet loses magnetism and the plate is connected to the screw again.
Again current produces magnetism, which attractsthe soft plate toward the hammer, and the hammer strikes the bell.
